column1: '''Hugo Bracegirdle''' was a Hobbit of [[the Shire]].
Hugo was the eldest child of [[Bruno Bracegirdle]], born in {{SR
column3: Boffin}}</ref> In his lifetime, he was notorious for borrowing books from [[Bilbo Baggins]], though he rarely returned them. In {{SR
column4: 1401}} he was a guest at [[Bilbo's Farewell Party]], after which Bilbo left Hugo an empty bookcase in which he could store all those books.<ref>{{FR

column1: [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] likened himself to Hugo Bracegirdle.<ref>See Paul Drayton's recollection of his and [[Humphrey Carpenter]]'s meeting with Tolkien in [[1967]]: ''The Hobbit, the Musical'', radio programme (London: [[BBC]], [[2012]])</ref>

column1: :Hugo lives at Number Eight, [[Bagshot Row]], a large house overlooking Sandyman's mill.
